question: Does the COPI coatomer complex regulate lipid homeostasis in cells, for example by limiting lipid storage and promoting lipolysis at lipid droplets? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: These data indicate that the COPI complex is an evolutionarily conserved regulator of lipid homeostasis, and highlight an interaction between vesicle transport systems and lipid droplets.
content.source_2: Using time-resolved proteomics and live-cell imaging in human adipocytes, depletion of COPI subunits did not alter the PAT/perilipin composition on lipid droplets or recruit ATGL to their surface, and neither basal nor forskolin-stimulated lipolysis changed significantly (Î”glycerol release <5%, p=0.42).
content.source_3: In yeast and Drosophila models, limiting lipid storage was independent of COPI; coatomer inhibition or ARF1 inactivation did not increase lipid droplet size or number, and total neutral lipid content was unchanged relative to controls (q>0.1), indicating the COPI transport complex is not required for restraining lipid accumulation.
